The Flowing Water and Dharma Sounds in the Pond, Part 22
The Buddha said:

Such sounds, in accordance with their wishes, are heard by all, bringing immeasurable joy and giving rise to pure minds free from all discrimination. With upright and impartial cultivation of wholesome roots, they are forever irreversible from supreme enlightenment.

In that world, one never again hears of hell, hungry ghosts, animals, yakshas, killing, stealing, fighting, harsh speech, or divisive speech. Such evil sounds are completely unheard of, let alone actually existing!
There are only natural pure sounds and natural blissful events. Therefore, that realm is called 'Ultimate Bliss.'
The Buddha said:

For the trees made of two jewels, the roots, trunk, branches, leaves, flowers, and fruits were interspersed with two jewels;
For the trees made of three jewels, the roots, trunk, branches, leaves, flowers, and fruits were interspersed with three jewels;
For the trees made of four jewels, the roots, trunk, and branches were made of a single jewel, while the flowers and fruits were the same as the roots and trunk;
For the trees made of five jewels, the roots, trunk, branches, leaves, and flowers were made of a single jewel, while the fruits were the same as the roots;
As for the six treasures making up one tree, the root, trunk, branches, leaves, flowers, and fruits are each made of one treasure;
As for the seven treasures making up one tree, it is also like this, only adding the node, which additionally uses one treasure.

In this way, the various trees have their own distinct patterns, planted in rows, with trunks facing each other, branches matching each other, leaves facing each other, flowers following each other, and fruits corresponding to each other. In this way, they line up for hundreds of thousands of miles, interspersed with jeweled ponds.

Moreover, in this way, it extends all around the world, with a splendor of flourishing colors that is overwhelming to behold. A gentle breeze occasionally arises, naturally producing a subtle and wonderful sound that is incomparable.
The Buddha said:
